hello.heading: My name is Lean Rada
text: I like making stuff and discovering new things.

works.info: Current job. Working on an app called Convene.
Worked on a P2P multiplayer card game on Android that features a disturbing Easter egg.
Made animated, sometimes interactive, Internet advertisements. Indirectly contributed to the rise of ad-blockers.
Made illustrated and animated biochemistry learning materials. Learned much about biology as I went. Did you know that mitochondria are the powerhouse of the cell?

schools.course: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
schools.name: University of the Philippines Manila

text: I'm a software developer, in case you didn't already know, who is currently inhabiting the Philippines. I like games, programming, art, and music, or any combination of those. As it happens, the ultimate combination of those four things is video game development, which is why I want to get into that field.
Other stuff that interest me are design, aesthetics, filmography, and engineering. Although I'm more interested in the processes than the products themselves.
more_text: Going deeper, I like computer science topics including, but not limited to: algorithms and data structures, artifical intelligence, computer graphics, and human-computer interaction (UX). Incidentally, gamedev involves everything on that list.

I enjoy playing puzzle games and innovative games (Portal is a great example of both). Game design is a neat field, or art if you like to consider it as an art, which is essentially the engineering of fun.

Currently, I listen to smooth jazz and chill hip-hop music, but I don't really like rapping or vocals. Luckily, there are some producers who make jazzhop without lyrics. Sometimes, I also make music. Someday, I'm gonna make a random music-generating program or maybe make a career out of music.
Well, this section is getting too long now. You may discover more stuff about me at another time. Until then, thanks for visiting!
